item.title: ‘I don’t wish to be petty’: My mom, 94, is leaving her $1 million estate to me, my brother and his daughter. Is that fair?
item.description: “My share of the home alone would be valued at $300K per the trust. If she distributes the funds three ways, my share becomes $200K.”

item.title: ‘My brother found God in recovery’: How do you save for retirement when ‘God will provide’ is your core value?
item.description: “Are there CFPs who are more aligned with a pragmatic, yet Christian, approach?”

item.title: I dumped my boyfriend because he earned $40K less than me. Am I a jerk for wanting my next partner to make more money?
item.description: Instead of focusing on money, it might be helpful to evaluate whether you find someone motivating and inspiring.

item.title: Money may not buy happiness, but it can buy a longer life
item.description: Older adults with the fewest financial resources die much earlier than those with more wealth.

item.title: AST SpaceMobile’s deal with Verizon validates the boom in satellite stocks
item.description: AST SpaceMobile’s stock was soaring after a deal with Verizon gave investors what they’ve been betting on and more.
